title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Modi inaugurates Safran MRO in Hyderabad
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *PM Modi* virtually inaugurated Safran Aircraft Engine Services India (SAESI) in Hyderabad, marking a milestone for domestic *MRO* capacity.
- The 45,000 sq m facility, with an initial investment of ₹1,300 crore, aims to service up to 300 LEAP engines annually and employ over 1,000 Indian engineers.
- Officials say expanding MRO capacity will boost *atmanirbharata*, reduce foreign exchange outflow, and strengthen India's aviation supply chain through domestic production.

items.title: SoftBank buys Ampere Computing to accelerate AI push
items.author: ETEnterpriseAI Desk
items.summary: - **SoftBank completes the acquisition of Ampere Computing**, making Ampere a wholly owned subsidiary with its finances consolidated into SoftBank’s results.\n- *Ampere* is known for **Arm-based processors** and targets **cloud workloads**, **AI apps**, and **high-performance computing**, strengthening SoftBank’s *AI computing push* and **data-centre infrastructure**.\n- Founded in 2017 in Santa Clara, Ampere positions itself as a challenger in the server processor market, emphasizing performance-per-watt and cloud-native scalability.

items.title: Vikram Solar launches 5 GW plant in Tamil Nadu, 9.5 GW cap
items.summary:
- **Vikram Solar** commissioned a 5 GW solar module plant at **Vallam, Tamil Nadu**, boosting total capacity to **9.5 GW**.
- The 27,000 sq m, fully automated facility uses robotics and **TOPCon** tech and is ready for upgrades to **HJT**, delivering higher module quality and faster timelines.
- Vallam expands **Vikram Solar**’s Tamil Nadu footprint, serving utility-scale, C&I and distributed generation nationwide, strengthening India’s solar value chain.

items.title: Parliament panel seeks uniform safety protocol for SAIL
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary: - The parliamentary standing committee called for *uniform safety protocols* across permanent and contract workers at **SAIL** during its review of the company’s structure and performance. - It emphasised *industrial safety standards*, *labour welfare*, and compliance with the four new labour codes that consolidate 29 laws. - Officials noted SAIL’s plants—Bokaro, Bhilai, and Rourkela—along with expansion plans and a decarbonisation roadmap, and cited the company’s half-year results (₹1,112 crore profit; ₹52,600 crore revenue).

items.title: Rajnath Singh urges global partners to co-develop maritime capabilities with India’s shipyards
Titagarh Rail plans to foray into wagon leasing business
TSMC sues ex-exec over trade secrets, Intel move
items.author: AFP
items.summary:
- **TSMC** has filed a lawsuit against former executive *Lo Wei-jen* alleging leakage of **trade secrets** to **Intel**.
- Lo Wei-jen retired in July and allegedly met with staff to understand advanced technologies currently under development at TSMC.
- The case, lodged in the Intellectual Property and Commercial Court, relies on non-compete and NDA agreements and may involve the **National Security Act**.

items.title: Spain to invest $868M in Diamond Foundry chip plant
items.summary:
- The *Spanish government* will invest 753 million euros ($868 million) in a Diamond Foundry chip plant in *Trujillo* to expand microchip manufacturing.
- The project aims to produce synthetic *diamond wafers* to improve heat dissipation and address chip overheating, a major industry bottleneck.
- *Diamond Foundry*, backed by Leonardo DiCaprio, plans further investment and runs existing facilities, signaling Europe’s push into diamond-based semiconductors.

items.title: HP to cut 6,000 jobs by 2028 as AI push grows
items.author: ETTelecom Desk
items.summary:
- HP Inc plans to cut 4,000 to 6,000 jobs globally by fiscal 2028 to streamline operations and accelerate **AI** adoption.
- The cuts will affect product development, internal operations, and customer support, with CEO Enrique Lores saying the move could deliver **$1 billion** in gross run-rate savings over three years.
- HP remains a top PC vendor and has benefited from demand for **AI-enabled PCs**, but rising memory-chip costs could pressure margins.

items.title: Zetwerk hires banks for IPO filing next year
items.summary:
- Zetwerk has hired banks to file its **IPO** papers in March 2026, led by **Kotak Mahindra Capital**, **Morgan Stanley**, **Avendus**, **Goldman Sachs**, **JM Financial** and **HSBC**.
- The listing could raise up to **$750 million**, with valuation work under way and **Bloomberg** reporting the plan.
- Zetwerk serves 3,500+ customers including Tata Steel, Mitsubishi and Honeywell, and recently raised nearly **$90 million** at a **$3.1B** valuation.

items.title: Semicon supply chains are in constant flux on tariffs, policy swings: Pure Storage CEO
Qatar's Ooredoo plans $500 million investment on cable projects
items.summary: - Ooredoo plans to invest more than *$500 million* in new international cable projects, reshaping routes across Oman, Iraq, Turkey and Europe.\n- CEO Aziz Aluthman Fakhroo says the system will *enhance global network flexibility*, create alternative routes that bypass the Red Sea and the *Strait of Hormuz*, and place the region at the heart of the international data network.\n- This strategy comes amid subsea cable outages and connectivity disruptions in the Gulf, with Ooredoo operating across the *Middle East, North Africa and Southeast Asia*.

items.title: ₹1,500cr mineral recycling scheme draws interest
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - The Centre's ₹1,500 crore Incentive Scheme for *Critical Mineral Recycling* is drawing strong early interest, with many entities registering on the application portal. - Mines Secretary Piyush Goyal reviewed progress alongside JNARDDC, the PMA, and linked the scheme to the *National Critical Mineral Mission* with registrations open from Oct 2, 2025 to Apr 1, 2026. - The scheme aims to build recycling capacity from secondary sources such as *e-waste* and *spent lithium-ion batteries*, with workshops and a helpdesk to support participants.

items.title: Marelli to accelerate automotive electronics development with new Bengaluru R&D facility
Zscaler tops quarterly estimates on strong cybersecurity demand
Pharma industry must shift to innovative products
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The pharma industry must move from post-patent launches to **R&D‑driven innovation**, expanding into *complex generics*, peptides, biosimilars, and biologics. 
- India aims to stay the *pharmacy of the world* by boosting exports while overhauling the pharmacy curriculum to cover the full value chain, from discovery to scalable manufacture. 
- Leaders call for *innovators, not just launchers*, as CPHI/PMEC India fosters faster collaboration and a stronger innovation wave.

items.title: Employment in unincorporated sector rises marginally to 12.85 cr in Jul-Sep quarter: Govt survey
Landlocked states to receive focused support under export promotion mission: Goyal
Vedanta poised for 16% annual growth in pre-tax earnings through FY28 on volume ramp-up: Report
India’s mega projects need a productivity leap – mechanisation and digitalisation can deliver it
Titan Intech, MIC to localise Indian display tech
items.summary:
- Titan Intech teams up with MIC to co-develop and localise LED/SMD/MiP/Mini-LED and LCD control systems in India, boosting *import substitution* and self-reliance.
- The seven-year deal covers about ₹135 crore for tech absorption, infra expansion and local production, with MIC providing design docs, hardware/firmware and licences for LED control tools (mLED Master Suite).
- Titan Intech gains exclusive Indian manufacturing rights and non-exclusive global R&D rights to export India-engineered display solutions under *TitanView* and *TitanPro*, aligning with *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat*.

items.title: ABB India and Deloitte alliance for AI-enabled manufacturing
items.summary:
- The alliance will embed digital intelligence across value chains to enable *connected operations* and *informed decision-making*.
- ABB India’s automation and digital platforms, including the *ABB Ability Genix* suite, will pair with Deloitte India’s transformation and cybersecurity capabilities to drive operational excellence.
- It aims to monitor real-time processes, boost productivity and energy efficiency, strengthen cyber resilience, and advance sustainability with digital safeguards.

items.title: CrisprBits raises $3M to scale CRISPR diagnostics
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *CrisprBits*, Bengaluru-based biotech startup, raised *$3 million* in a *Pre-Series A* led by *Spectrum Impact*, valuing the company at *$12 million*.
- Funds will scale the *PathCrisp* diagnostics and expand manufacturing for *human health*, *food safety*, and *animal health*, plus a *CRISPR-based strain engineering* platform for biofuels.
- CEO *Vijay Chandru* says the funding enables launches in *India* and global expansion, highlighting *synthetic biology* and AI-augmented systems.

items.title: Pavna Industries signs MoU with UP govt for ₹250 crore
items.summary:
- *Pavna Industries* signs *MoU* with the Government of *Uttar Pradesh* for *₹250 crore* investment over *3-5 years*, creating about *500 jobs*.
- The investment will expand capacity in *automotive components manufacturing* and boost *industrial development* in *Uttar Pradesh*.
- MD *Swapnil Jain* says the milestone underscores Pavna's commitment to the *manufacturing sector* and *job creation* with UP government's support.

items.title: ASMA urges duty cut on primary aluminium
items.summary:
- **ASMA** has urged the government to reduce *import duty on primary aluminium* to rationalise domestic prices and support downstream industries facing high input costs.
- The letter highlights that the current 7.5% tariff inflates costs and, with FTAs like ASEAN-India, finished goods can enter at zero duty, creating a price disadvantage.
- It argues a duty cut would create a *level playing field* for India’s downstream MSMEs and help them compete domestically and internationally.

items.title: Blue Cloud, Byte Eclipse form JV for next-gen edge-AI processors
Air India to add 26 aircraft in 2026
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- Air India plans to induct **26 aircraft in 2026** (including **6 wide‑bodies** and **20 narrow‑bodies**) while returning some leased 777s and retiring others to keep capacity steady.
- The real capacity boost will come in **2027–28** as large orders materialize, with the **787** refurbishment and fleet upgrades driving most gains.
- Despite delays from global supply chains, **81% of international ops** will be served by upgraded aircraft by end‑2026, with upgrades to interiors, IFE, Wi‑Fi and the *Maharaja loyalty program*.

items.title: ACME Solar signs 200 MW solar+storage PPA with SECI
items.summary:
- ACME Solar signs a *PPA* with *SECI* via its subsidiary for 200 MW solar plus 100 MW/400 MWh *BESS* at ₹3.42 per unit.
- SECI awarded LOA for 350 MW in 2024; ACME had 150 MW PPAs earlier, and the latest milestone brings full capacity under *PPA* with commissioning expected by June 2027.
- The project targets 25–27% annual *CUF* during solar hours, with 70% monthly and 85% annual availability during evening peak; total signed capacity rises to about 5,380 MW including *BESS*.

items.title: Global disruptions hit Adani’s Kutch copper plant
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Kutch Copper Ltd.* is operating with far less ore than required, as global disruptions limit copper concentrate for Adani's 500,000-tonne plant. 
- The smelter needs about 1.6 million tonnes to run at full strength, but has imported only around 147,000 tonnes in 10 months, delaying ramp-up and raising costs. 
- Analysts warn the plant could incur short-term losses and may prompt measures like higher tariffs to shield domestic metals, reflecting wider supply constraints.

items.title: Chhattisgarh allots land for ₹10k-cr semiconductor plant
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The Chhattisgarh government allotted 11.28 acres in Nava Raipur to *Artificial Electronics Intelligent Materials* (**AEIM**) for a ₹10,000 crore **semiconductor materials** plant with a capital subsidy up to 40%. 
- Phase 1 is due by May 2026 with commercial production targeted for Q3 FY26; the unit will manufacture sapphire ingots, wafers, optoelectronic components and electronic substrates. 
- AEIM expects more than 4,000 direct jobs; the project aims to position *Raipur* as a global semiconductor hub, per officials.

items.title: India-Canada fast-tracks FTA; deeper minerals & AI ties
items.author: ETEnterpriseAI Desk
items.summary:
- *India and Canada* will **fast-track** negotiations on a bilateral *Free Trade Agreement* to boost trade and investment.
- They seek deeper cooperation in *critical minerals* and their processing, *nuclear energy*, and emerging tech like *AI*, data centres, and quantum computing.
- Modi invited Carney to visit India as talks align with the EPTA and the Australia-Canada-India tech partnership to advance cooperation in *critical and emerging technologies*.

items.title: Airfloa Rail Technology, BBBS set up defence manufacturing JV
BEL shares rise on HAMMER deal with Safran
items.summary:
- BEL shares rose over 1.5% in early trade on reports of a **50:50** JV with **Safran Electronics and Defence** to manufacture and supply *HAMMER* air-to-ground munitions in India for the **Indian Air Force** and **Indian Navy**. 
- The JV will be set up as a private limited company with a **50:50** ownership, focusing on manufacturing, supply and maintenance of *HAMMER* munitions for the Indian armed forces. 
- BEL's PAT for the September quarter was ₹1,287.16 crore (up 33% YoY) and its order book reached a record ₹74,453 crore as of Nov 2025, underscoring strong and long-term demand for indigenous defence systems.

items.title: India, France to co-produce HAMMER munitions via BEL-Safran
items.summary:
- BEL and Safran sign a 50:50 private JV to manufacture *HAMMER* munitions in India, pushing *indigenisation* to ~60%.
- *HAMMER* is a glide bomb with up to 70 km range that can use 250, 500 and 1,000 kg warheads, designed to resist *jamming* and operate in varied weather.
- The deal follows India's 2020 procurement during the Ladakh standoff and will supply the *IAF* and Indian Navy, aligning with Make-in-India and domestic defense goals.

items.title: Nuvoco Vistas up more than 6% in early trade among top movers
BlackRock arm buys stake in ACC, Acutaas Chemicals
items.summary:
- BlackRock's arm, via *iShares Core MSCI Emerging Markets ETF*, bought *ACC*, *Acutaas Chemicals* and *TD Power Systems* for ₹359 crore through NSE bulk deals.
- It bought 9.82 lakh *ACC*, 5.3 lakh *Acutaas Chemicals*, and 9.68 lakh *TD Power Systems* shares at avg prices ₹1,911.86, ₹1,852.12 and ₹759.08.
- After the deals, *ACC* rose 5.46%, *Acutaas Chemicals* 10.18%, and *TD Power Systems* 6.25% on the NSE.

items.title: ACME Solar wins 130 MW in REMCL RTC auction
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - *ACME Solar* emerged as the winning bidder for 130 MW in REMCL's 1,000 MW RTC tender, signaling demand for dispatchable renewable power.\n- *Its bid of ₹4.35 per unit* was selected, and the *LoA* is expected within the tender timelines; the project is to be commissioned within *30 months*, aided by existing land and connectivity.\n- *To meet availability targets* (75% for the first three years and 85% thereafter), the mix will include solar capacity with energy storage and wind to ensure firm supply.

items.title: India offers collaboration potential on critical minerals, its processing to Canada: Piyush Goyal
Solar panel exports slump in September as US tariffs bite
items.summary:
- *India*’s September solar module exports slumped to about $80 million from $134 million in August as *US tariffs* bite and shipments reroute to the domestic market.
- The US measures, including a **50% tariff** on Indian goods and tighter scrutiny on Chinese components, have muted overseas demand and nudged some players toward consolidation.
- Domestic oversupply fears persist with annual installations below targets; industry expects capacity to reach **165 GW** by 2027 and some firms pivot to **cells/wafer** lines.

items.title: MRPL buys Murban crude for January loading
items.summary:
- **MRPL** bought 2 million barrels of *Abu Dhabi Murban* crude for January loading via a BP tender.
- The purchase underscores a shift away from *Russian oil* as Indian refiners seek alternatives amid sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil.
- Earlier this month MRPL bought 1 million barrels of *Basra Medium* crude for January 1–7 delivery.

items.title: Why scaling nuclear is critical for net-zero path
GAIL floats LNG swap tender for US-loaded cargoes
items.summary:
- *GAIL* issued a swap tender offering two US-loaded LNG cargoes in exchange for two delivered ex-ship cargoes to the *Dabhol terminal*, with delivery windows Jan 27–31, 2025 and Feb 1–7, 2025.
- The two US cargoes would load on a FOB basis on Jan 27 at *Sabine Pass*, LA and Mar 10 at *Cove Point*, MD.
- The tender closes on Nov 25, 2025.

items.title: WTE plants, waste segregation part of long-term pollution plan for Delhi
Rising component costs may force cos to pull plug on entry-level 5G phones
SK Hynix looks for local partner to set up memory assembly unit in India
Tejas refutes Airtel: interference from near BSNL sites
items.author: ETTelecom Desk
items.summary:
- Tejas Networks refuted *Airtel*'s claims, saying interference stems from sites deployed very close to *BSNL* network, raising the *noise floor*. 
- A Tejas executive stated the issue is proximity to BSNL, not Tejas radios' emissions, and that the radios meet **3GPP/TEC specs**. 
- The letter notes *BSNL* has deployed antennas with built‑in filters at many sites and urges *Airtel* to work with *BSNL* to install filters at additional sites.

items.title: Stallion India Fluorochemicals reaffirms FY26 revenue growth guidance of 30–35%
Indore SEZ exports jump 32% on pharma orders
items.summary: - Exports from *Indore SEZ* rose 32% to ₹8,127.67 crore in April–October, helped by increased orders from *pharmaceutical units*.\n- About *70%* of exports from *Indore SEZ* are **pharmaceuticals**, with the United States among top importers.\n- The SEZ spans 572 hectares in the *Pithampur Industrial Area*, hosting 59 plants including 22 in **pharma**.

items.title: Zepto Logic signs ₹250-cr pact with TN for chip design
items.author: Ashutosh Kumar, ETTelecom
items.summary:
- Zepto Logic and the Tamil Nadu government signed a *₹250-crore* MoU to set up a fabless chip design house and a *VLSI skilling centre*. 
- The centre will focus on *system-on-chips*, *IP*, *ASICs* and *FPGAs*, with core design services backed by *Caliber Embedded Technologies*. 
- The move aims to build an indigenous *chip design* ecosystem and a long-term semiconductor innovation campus for *R&D*, IP development and downstream manufacturing.

items.title: Rolls-Royce sees India’s private power business overtaking government by 2026-27
